page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: As stated in the review this is mainly an agricultural area with almost 100% of the available farmland being grassland for dairy cattle. The area is ideally suited for this type of farming.It is not only flat but receives relatively high rainfall throughout the year.Also soil conditions combined with the use of chemical fertilisers help to produce high quality grass for pasture,silage or hay. Therefore in this area it is fairly obvious the farmer's main preoccupation is with the continued maintenance of his dairy herd.This,of course,is his main source of income. His year is geared to milking, improving pasture land,cutting and storing grass for silage and the growing of winter cereals for fodder.
